intro: Colquhounia elegans var. pauciflora, commonly known as the slender colquhounia, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, fragrant flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows as a shrub with slender, often hairy stems and small, opposite leaves. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest margins or along stream banks.
